result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L.H. Maxam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than July 29, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant must obtain and maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA comply with any treatment recommendations at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew L.H. Maxam in court with attorney Hannah E Huettl.  Defendant Matthew L.H. Maxam in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received revocation packet. No corrections to revocation packet.  Argument by Attorney Tlusty.  Argument by Attorney Huettl.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders two years prison consisting of one year initial confinement with one year extended supervision conditions of extended supervision are court costs; AODA to be completed at agent's discretion and comply with any recommendations; obtain/maintain full time employment.  Defendant is eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.  408 days sentence credit.  Appeal rights given to defendant.   - rt

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Matthew L.H. Maxam in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Matthew L.H. Maxam in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Count 1 is amended to possession of THC 2nd - without the enhancement.  Plea of no contest to amended count 1.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Schoenborn.  No statement by defendant.   Court orders withheld sentence probation for 2 years; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; 90 days county jail with huber to begin no later than July 29, 2016 at 4:30 pm  any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.   Appeal rights given to defendant. - rt

Arrest Report

ADR began at 10:36 am.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew L.H. Maxam appears in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Court questions defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is March 15, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
